Posts.Content: Jun 22, 2009 09:42PM PanamaBound wrote: I breastfed and got it twice.  I also don't eat meat, drink hormone free milk, have no family with BC and exercise.  If you wonder what you did "wrong", you'll just make yourself nuts
Posts.Title: Just a Weird Though Irishred PanamaBound

Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2009 03:56PM PanamaBound wrote: You may have a lot of calcifications - which have to be biopsied and are usually nothing.  More than likely it's scar tissue but they still have to check.
Posts.Title: concerns with 1st mamo. after lump. connette connette

Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2009 06:40PM PanamaBound wrote: I have a friend who had phillodes, had it removed and is doing very well.  I know it's very rare and I haven't seen anyone one these boards who has mentioned it.  Good luck
Posts.Title: Need information on Phllodes tumor for 16 year old! judyr roseg

Posts.Content: Jul 1, 2009 09:12AM PanamaBound wrote: I think it's important for newcomers to be able to read about the success stories.  When we first hear, many of us only focus on all the negative things that could happen.  In reality, it's a tough road but breast cancer is so different today than only a few years ago.  When I first came to these boards, I was petrified.  Thanks to people like you, I got answers, advice and confidence. Thank you.
Posts.Title: I am done angie27 Maire67

Posts.Content: Jun 27, 2009 12:28AM PanamaBound wrote: I had both, just at 2 different times.  My DCIS - meaning it is only in the duct, is a very early stage of cancer.  Mine was actually Stage 0.  IDS means that it has spread to outside the duct. I had a lumpectomy for the DCIS and mammosite radiation.  Because it returned, I chose a BL the second time for IDC. Best of luck to you.
